<<Save-the-NPC levels? Hang on, are there such things? Is there a way you 
can make it so if a certain NPC dies, the level ends in failure for your 
team? Or is an unnoficial rule that if that character dies, you have to 
quit?>>

Yes, in Scen.exe you can access the level properties by hitting asterisk, 
and specify whether you need to kill everything on a level, kill all 
generators, keep the NPCs alive, etc. There's also a level difficulty rating 
that you can specify, but I've experimented with it and it doesn't seem to 
affect anything.

<<Well I took both of your suggestions. First of all, I downloaded the 
Tevfifty (right?) levels. Well they sure seem hard enough, however I'm kind 
of disappointed with the lack of detail you put into the maps. And why do 
you choose hordes of weak lvl guys instead of some tough guys? (Don't take 
it personally I'm just asking)>>

I thought the maps were pretty good. I strive for realism (a tall order in 
this game), and what's more real than grass on the plains, trees in the 
forests, water in the ocean, etc.? What else do you want? Let me tell you, 
some of those levels, like the Labyrinth, were damn hard to make, and I'm 
justly proud of them. And as for the enemies... if I was an overlord and I 
wanted to wipe out an invading army, would I summon my soldiers and have 
them attack as a unit, or would I get Jimmy Olsen's signal watch and summon 
Superman to save the day? I can't think of many situations in which a single 
person would be more effective in combat than an army. I take it you haven't 
gotten very far yet... there are some NASTY enemy NPCs later on. Derrida is 
going to kill you at least twice, I guarantee it. Unless you're playing on 
Skirmish with a DPH-style cadre of demigods, that is... and where's the fun 
in that?

<<Second, I tried to make some of my own levels. I think I did a good job on 
the map detail, and the plot could really go somewhere, however so far it is 
a set story, so you have to play the levels in order. But I need to know: 
which numbers are good to use. Right now Im using lvl 50, 51 and 52. And how 
tough should i make it? Right now you're fighting baddies on lvl 4 - 7. If 
you think it should be harder, speak up. I tested this map with my lvl 14 
archer on battle and he had a tough time.>>

You'll have to specify what you mean about the map detail... there are a 
very limited number of map tiles available to us, and it's hard to achieve 
certain effects with them. I had to manually create new column tiles for 
some of my stuff, and I'm still not satisfied with the up-stairs down-stairs 
convention I had to use. I believe Ricky Der is using the levels up to 100, 
so you should probably pick again. Oh, now might be a good time to let 
people know that some levels are included in Levels.001 and can't be 
overwritten--levels 61, 80-84, 88, and 99... Easy enough to work around, 
assuming you know they're there. I don't know why it isn't said in the help 
files that there is a gameplay tutorial starting at level 80. It might have 
helped people a bunch. Level 61 uses map tiles with numbers beyond the upper 
limit, so it won't run, which is a shame, because it seemed to have a nice 
story to it. Here's what I was able to recover: "Welcome to Gladiator 
Version 3 PRESS F1 TO GET HELP WHILE IN the game.  The help page 
willdescribe the keys used in the game.  This text will be used at the 
beginning of each scenario to let you know where you are and what you should 
be DOING. WE PICK UP A SAMPLE ADVENTURE IN THE MIDDLE. JOURNAL ENTRY 61: IT 
IS SAID THAT THE WITCH CASSANDRA WAS BURIED BENEATH THE TEMPLE SHE 
MINISTERED OVER IN THE WASTELAND VALLEY. AS A CHILD, I HEARD MANY LEGENDS OF 
THE WITCH'S TEMPLE, AND NOW I STAND READY TO RISK OUR LIVES TO CONFIRM THEM. 
I PRAY THEY BE FALSE. OUR SCOUTS REPORT THAT A FIST OF KULLAN'S FORCES ARE 
ALREADY IN THE PROCESS OF SECURING THE WITCH'S TOMB. KULLAN HIMSELF WILL 
ARRIVE SOON. I DO NOT RELISH THE IDEA OF THROWING MY LIFE AWAY ON SELFLESS 
ACTS, BUT IF THE LEGENDS ARE TRUE, THE REPERCUSSIONS WOULD BE UNIMAGINABLE. 
IF THE ARTIFACT LIES BY CASSANDRA'S SIDE WITHIN THE BARREN TEMPLE, IT CANNOT 
FALL INTO KULLAN'S HANDS. IF SO, ALL HOPE IS LOST . . . . FOR ALL OF US. WE 
MOVE HESITANTLY INTO THE WASTELAND VALLEY." I think level 88 was designed as 
a way to get a whole lot of money before starting in the regular levels, and 
level 99 was just some junk that got included for no real reason. That's all 
for now...
   -Tevildo, Prince of Cats.
